lexUnit.name: dodge.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: avoid by a sudden quick movement

sentence.text: Last week SNM guerrillas took me into Somalia from Djibouti , a crossing made on foot by night , dodging police and army patrols .
He could dodge two coppers in a car easily .
Probably he could dodge the twenty coppers in ten cars that would be there in five minutes , and get clear away .
As it was , marchers approaching John Street had to dodge a fusillade of missiles thrown by the loyalists .
Her brothers and sisters , sisters-in-law , all the clan dodged the ricocheting missiles , clustered in the corners , watched with appalled glee .
Trouble is , Piper , some people do not appreciate good music , especially when they are dodging flying shrapnel .
Helen clutched Edward 's arm as they dodged through the traffic .
After a short persuit through the city streets the driver tried to dodge traffic at the Barton Gates junction on Eastgate street .
Nor can you dodge these attacks by approaching obliquely .
Sara ducked her head to dodge low branches ; brambles tore at her legs .
I dodged herds of joggers , cyclists , people playing croquet , baseball , and walked into the theatrical bustle of an operatic cast preparing for an open air performance of Madam Butterfly .
It was a struggle for bites in the Leeds Shimano Open on the Aire at Leeds where anglers had to dodge floating ice .
She dodged a wet sponge .
DoT detention orders are still in force from last July when Jack dodged naval forces and coastguards from 14 countries to sail to the Arctic Circle and back .

SPENDING Christmas zapping aliens or helping Sonic the Hedgehog to dodge graphic nasties might sound mindless to parents -- but it could be great mental exercise for thousands of computer game-crazy youngsters .
Too busy counting up the dollars deposited for them in numbered bank accounts -- the Bahamas , Switzerland , any place where they can dodge the tax man .
They had dodged the farmers who covered the Paris-Brussels motorway with potatoes .
4 bullets dodged by chase cop
He tries a head-butt which I dodge , and I clip a neat jab across his chin which rocks but does n't fell him .
He screamed ` She 's my property " as terrified David Berry dodged the blows with just a towel protecting his ` prime cuts " , a court heard yesterday .
